intro: Gilia aggregata f. pulchella, commonly known as the showy gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with a white throat. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. The plant is also noted for its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid conditions.
